text: 1,3,5-Triethylbenzene is a chemical compound of the group of aromatic hydrocarbons. == Preparation == 1,3,5-Triethylbenzene can be prepared by a Friedel-Crafts alkylation of benzene with ethyl bromide in presence of aluminum chloride. :Reaction scheme of the synthesis of 1,3,5-Triethylbenzene. == Properties == 1,3,5-Triethylbenzene is a flammable, hard to ignite, colorless liquid that is almost insoluble in water. The refractive index is 1.495 == Uses == 1,3,5-Triethylbenzene can be used in synthesis of a series of di- and trinucleating ligands. == Safety notes == The vapour of 1,3,5-Triethylbenzene can form an explosive mixture with air (flash point: 76 °C). == References == ==See also== *1,3,5-Triheptylbenzene Category:Alkylbenzenes
title: 1,3,5-Triethylbenzene
